dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara run out (Dawlat Zadran/Mohammad Nabi) 76 (102b 6x4 1x6 136m) SR: 74.5

dismissalComment.html: Sanga is gone now! His luck runs out and finally Afghanistan strike! Dawlat produced a wonderful yorker that Angelo just about dug out towards square leg. He was off balance, so was not going to look for a run, but Sanga wanted to get to the other end and charged down manically. By the time he realised there was no run, it was too late as an accurate throw was fired to the bowler. Dawlat takes the stumps out. Infact, Angelo looked for a run initially and said NO after a delay

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 45 (41b 4x4 0x6 70m) SR: 109.75

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's chopped on! KJP's laboured stay comes to an end! He has played some good shots, but has struggled for timing today. He tries to punch this length delivery on the up through covers, but the lack of pace means he is early in the shot. The ball takes an inside edge and clatters on to the stumps.. This is going to be a tricky pitch.. It's slow, very slow and Afghanistan are bowling very well

oh that's a big wicket! Mahela plays a loose loose shot here! He was looking to chip it over the bowler's head but only gets a toe-end to it to lob it tamely towards mid-on where the fielder moves a little to his left and takes a simple overhead catch. It was not a full delivery, and came slow of the pitch. What a strike this is! Mirwais has been bowling brilliantly and gets some reward. That wicket was more than 11000 ODI runs

that's the middle stump gone! Thirimanne goes forward to play a loose drive, it wasn't the right line for it. He leaves a big gap between the bat and pad. Shapoor bowled it full and this one came in a touch too, but that was a loose shot from the batsman. Excellent bowling from Shapoor.

dismissalText.commentary: Chaturanga de Silva c Mirwais Ashraf b Dawlat Zadran 17 (16b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 106.25

dismissalComment.html: another wicket! another soft dismissal! Sri Lanka are falling apart. De Silva flicks this short of length delivery straight to midwicket. He perhaps wanted to go squarer, but the extra pace from Dawlat meant he wasn't able to get it to the desired direction...

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi lbw b de Silva 37 (43b 3x4 1x6 66m) SR: 86.04

dismissalComment.html: he raps the batsman on the pads, appeals persistently and the umpire gives away! It was flatter, quicker and it turned a touch too. Nabi was looking to sweep it and was hit in front of middle and leg. That pitched on leg and straightened Seven down now..

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan b NLTC Perera 27 (34b 5x4 0x6 41m) SR: 79.41

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Stanikzai was playing well, but he has been sent back now. Thisara can ramp up pace at times and he does it here too, bowls a fuller length after delivering quite a few shorter deliveries. The batsman remained rooted to the crease and plays outside the line. The offstump takes a beating

dismissalComment.html: the off stump takes a beating! Too rash from Shahzad, some would say. He gets the front leg out of the way, wanted to smash it over mid-on, gives himself too much room and plays an ungainly cross-batted swat.. Unfortunately for him, he makes no connection and the ball hits the top of off..Quick exit for Shahzad

dismissalText.long: c NLTC Perera b de Silva
dismissalText.commentary: Mirwais Ashraf c NLTC Perera b de Silva 1 (18b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 5.55

commentTextItems.html: and everytime they have looked for a shot, they have given their wickets away! The batsman tries to drive it over cover, but gets a thick outside edge to short third man. Sri Lanka are through to the final of the Asia Cup again

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all from the comms today. Andrew Fernando is updating the match report as I type and there will be more analysis later. Tomorrow, it's Pakistan v Bangladesh. We will be back with our coverage tomorrow. Till then, ciao ciao

"It was a very important game for us because we had to book our place in the final,"says Angelo Mathews. "They have a very good bowling attack and our batsmen found it hard, it was a slow pitch too. It was a collective effort from Thisara Perera - he scored some useful runs and picked up those crucial three wickets."

"We bowled brilliantly in the first 35 overs and Sangakkara played very well," says Mohammad Nabi. "We started well with the bat, but then Mendis and Malinga bowled brilliantly. It was difficult to pick Malinga."

Kumar Sangakkara is the man of the match. He says, "It was a tough wicket to bat on, so we had to spend some time to build a foundation. You can't take anything for granted, the Afghan team played very well, they exploited the pitch very well. There is nothing guaranteed in cricket, you can be in fine form, but it takes only one ball for you to get out, so you have to enjoy while it goes well."

A stifling bowling performance by Sri Lanka, reiterating their dominant run in the tournament. Their batsmen took them to a very good total on a difficult pitch, their bowlers then ensured there were no heroics from Afghanistan this time. Mendis and Malinga were expected to be the danger men, but it was Perera who reaped most rewards. Mendis and de Silva then ran through the tail in no time.

Terance Rodrigu: "Another disappointing innings by the afghans. They bowl so brilliantly to the opposition that they give this ray of hope of winning, but their batsman end up giving yet another bonus point to the opposition. Kudos to the bowlers."

commentTextItems.html: the innings has stalled completely, the batsman defends again
flatter delivery this time, the batsman pushes it to midwicket

commentPostTextItems.html: Faisal Sami Qad: "@Steve Austin, Thats actually not the case. A Sri Lanka win would still leave all the 4 teams open in the competition. If Pakistan lose to Bang and India Beat Afghanistan with a bonus point (or vice versa) and then Bangladesh beat Sri Lanka. These results will lead the final spot open for Pakistan and 2 more teams and the situation will be decided by the runrate."

commentTextItems.html: tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman drives it to point

dismissalText.commentary: Dawlat Zadran b Mendis 0 (8b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: tossed up delivery outside off, this time the batsman thinks about driving and leaves a gap between the bat and pad, it's a googly again and it hit the middle and leg stump. Another one for Mendis. Sri Lanka are closing doors on Afghanistan quickly

commentPostTextItems.html: Steve Austin: "So let me get this perfectly clear. The moment Sri Lanka win, Afghanistan and India are eliminated and Sri Lanka are through. This leaves Bangladesh and Pakistan to fight for the last place."

tossed up on off stump line, the batsman defends it back to the bowler
fuller and quicker, the batsman comes forward and defends
another googly, but this one is spinning down the leg side. It hits the pads and they runs a single

commentPostTextItems.html: Adz Bizzle: "The difference between the sides in this tournament has been the strength of sri-lankas bat & bowl. where as other teams may have only dominated in one department. The sri-lankans have alot of variety in the bowling department and in the batting they have the experience of sanga who has been their main backbone. Will sri-lanka be able to muster up one more courageous effort in the final. it most likely seems to be sri-pak final & we all know what Pak can do on the day."

commentTextItems.html: fuller delivery on off, the batsman drives it straight to cover
this one is much closer to the off stump, but beats the outside edge again

commentPreTextItems.html: mykindagame: "teams should be smart in taking powerplays. If malinga is best at opening overs and also death overs, why doesnt an opposing team take the power play around the 15th or 20th..tonight should have been the best example, lasith bowled 5 and the afgans should have taken the power play striaght,which mean he will bowl another 3.."

flatter outside off, the batsman leaves it alone
fuller delivery, it's driven to wide long off, first in 21 balls
he opens the face of the bat to guide it to third man, but can't beat the slip fielder
tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman defends it to point

commentPreTextItems.html: Only two more wickets remaining and Afghanistan are still short 79 short of 203, the bonus point marker..

commentTextItems.html: lots of flight on this one, but the batsman is able to defend it easily

dismissalComment.html: he throws it away, Chandimal! Tries to go inside out over extra cover, but the tossed up delivery lands on middle stump line, spins past the outside edge and takes the off stump out! Beautifully bowled by Hotak. That dipped and spun.

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne b Shapoor Zadran 5 (16b 0x4 0x6 20m) SR: 31.25

dismissalComment.html: that's the middle stump gone! Thirimanne goes forward to play a loose drive, it wasn't the right line for it. He leaves a big gap between the bat and pad. Shapoor bowled it full and this one came in a touch too, but that was a loose shot from the batsman. Excellent bowling from Shapoor.

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera b Mirwais Ashraf 33 (49b 4x4 1x6 63m) SR: 67.34

dismissalComment.html: that's chopped on! KJP's laboured stay comes to an end! He has played some good shots, but has struggled for timing today. He tries to punch this length delivery on the up through covers, but the lack of pace means he is early in the shot. The ball takes an inside edge and clatters on to the stumps.. This is going to be a tricky pitch.. It's slow, very slow and Afghanistan are bowling very well

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Mohammad Nabi b Mirwais Ashraf 14 (14b 2x4 0x6 28m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: oh that's a big wicket! Mahela plays a loose loose shot here! He was looking to chip it over the bowler's head but only gets a toe-end to it to lob it tamely towards mid-on where the fielder moves a little to his left and takes a simple overhead catch. It was not a full delivery, and came slow of the pitch. What a strike this is! Mirwais has been bowling brilliantly and gets some reward. That wicket was more than 11000 ODI runs

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal b Amir Hamza 26 (41b 1x4 0x6 60m) SR: 63.41

dismissalComment.html: he throws it away, Chandimal! Tries to go inside out over extra cover, but the tossed up delivery lands on middle stump line, spins past the outside edge and takes the off stump out! Beautifully bowled by Hotak. That dipped and spun.

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara run out (Dawlat Zadran/Mohammad Nabi) 76 (102b 6x4 1x6 136m) SR: 74.5

dismissalComment.html: Sanga is gone now! His luck runs out and finally Afghanistan strike! Dawlat produced a wonderful yorker that Angelo just about dug out towards square leg. He was off balance, so was not going to look for a run, but Sanga wanted to get to the other end and charged down manically. By the time he realised there was no run, it was too late as an accurate throw was fired to the bowler. Dawlat takes the stumps out. Infact, Angelo looked for a run initially and said NO after a delay

headshotImage.caption: Chaturanga de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mirwais Ashraf b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Chaturanga de Silva c Mirwais Ashraf b Dawlat Zadran 17 (16b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 106.25

dismissalComment.html: another wicket! another soft dismissal! Sri Lanka are falling apart. De Silva flicks this short of length delivery straight to midwicket. He perhaps wanted to go squarer, but the extra pace from Dawlat meant he wasn't able to get it to the desired direction...

headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad b Lakmal 7 (7b 0x4 1x6 8m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: the off stump takes a beating! Too rash from Shahzad, some would say. He gets the front leg out of the way, wanted to smash it over mid-on, gives himself too much room and plays an ungainly cross-batted swat.. Unfortunately for him, he makes no connection and the ball hits the top of off..Quick exit for Shahzad

headshotImage.longCaption: Chaturanga de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Noor Ali Zadran c de Silva b Mendis 21 (41b 2x4 0x6 62m) SR: 51.21

dismissalComment.html: caught at point! Noor Ali's vigil ends as he drives the tossed up delivery, but he didn't account for the turn. This one went away after pitching, caught a thick outside edge and was taken easily at point..

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan b NLTC Perera 27 (34b 5x4 0x6 41m) SR: 79.41

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Stanikzai was playing well, but he has been sent back now. Thisara can ramp up pace at times and he does it here too, bowls a fuller length after delivering quite a few shorter deliveries. The batsman remained rooted to the crease and plays outside the line. The offstump takes a beating

dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal c Sangakkara b NLTC Perera 4 (13b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 30.76

dismissalComment.html: and another one! This one is a soft dismissal as Mangal gets a faint edge in trying to guide the length ball to third man. Afghanistan are in trouble here

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari c Thirimanne b Lakmal 6 (19b 0x4 0x6 22m) SR: 31.57

dismissalComment.html: Lakmal strikes! the batsman has a lazy waft at a length delivery outside off and he gets a thick outside edge that flies straight to the lone slip fielder. Thirimanne takes a good catch

headshotImage.caption: Chaturanga de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chaturanga de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi lbw b de Silva 37 (43b 3x4 1x6 66m) SR: 86.04

dismissalComment.html: he raps the batsman on the pads, appeals persistently and the umpire gives away! It was flatter, quicker and it turned a touch too. Nabi was looking to sweep it and was hit in front of middle and leg. That pitched on leg and straightened Seven down now..

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran c Mathews b NLTC Perera 11 (35b 1x4 0x6 43m) SR: 31.42

dismissalComment.html: he drives again and drives it in the air, straight to the fielder at cover! The shot was on as it was a fuller delivery, but he didn't put anything behind that drive. Turned out to be a tame push and the fielder took it easily. The partnership is broken two short of fifty. Third wicket for Perera

headshotImage.caption: Chaturanga de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chaturanga de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c NLTC Perera b de Silva
dismissalText.commentary: Mirwais Ashraf c NLTC Perera b de Silva 1 (18b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 5.55

dismissalComment.html: and everytime they have looked for a shot, they have given their wickets away! The batsman tries to drive it over cover, but gets a thick outside edge to short third man. Sri Lanka are through to the final of the Asia Cup again

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Amir Hamza lbw b Mendis 1 (14b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 7.14

dismissalComment.html: a googly gets him a wicket! He was not reading the spin and pays with his wicket as he pushes outside the line. The ball spun in and hit the batsman on his back leg, right in front

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dawlat Zadran b Mendis 0 (8b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: tossed up delivery outside off, this time the batsman thinks about driving and leaves a gap between the bat and pad, it's a googly again and it hit the middle and leg stump. Another one for Mendis. Sri Lanka are closing doors on Afghanistan quickly

milestones.description: Shapoor has broken the record for most ducks (3) in ODIs for AFG, going past Karim Sadiq's 3
Mohammad Nabi has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (30) for AFG, going past Samiullah Shinwari

series.name: Asia Cup
series.description: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka in Bangladesh

seriesStandings.notes:
Preliminary Matches Win, with bonus point - 5
Win, without bonus point - 4
Tie or No Result - 2
Loss - 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points, the right to play in the final match or series will be determined as follows:
  • The team with the most number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the most number of wins over the other team(s) who are equal on points and have the same number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the highest number of bonus points
  • If still equal, the team with the highest net run rate
In a match declared as no result, run rate is not applicable. Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. Bonus Points The team that achieves a run rate of 1.25 times that of the opposition shall be awarded one bonus point. A team's run rate will be calculated by reference to the runs scored in an innings divided by the number of overs faced. refer to Appendix 6 Final Match or Series If no result is achieved in a final the match shall be declared drawn. In the event of a drawn final, the teams will be declared as Joint Champion and the prize money will be shared equally between the two competing teams.

recentReportStory.title: Sri Lanka cruise to final with third win
recentReportStory.subTitle: Afghanistan v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Sri Lanka cruise to final with third win
recentReportStory.summary: Afghanistan's bowlers limited Sri Lanka to 253, but their batsmen were unable to raise to the challenge. Sri Lanka's 129-run win assures them a spot in the Asia Cup final
recentReportStory.byline: The Report by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Kumar Sangakkara works the ball off his pads
image.longCaption: Kumar Sangakkara works the ball off his pads, Afghanistan v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur

recentReportStory.credit: Andrew Fidel Fernando is ESPNcricinfo's Sri Lanka correspondent. He tweets here
